text: Josephine Webb (June 21, 1918 â€“ 2017) was an American electrical engineer. She was known as "switchgear". She designed an eighteen-inch, full newspaper size fax machine with superior resolution. Webb co-founded Webb Consulting Company with her husband, also an electrical engineer. She was one of the first female electrical engineers, and considered a pioneer by the Society of Women Engineers. At Purdue University, she was one out of a total of five women engineers. Webb died in 2017, at the age of 99. ==References== Category:1918 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Engineers from New York (state) Category:American inventors Category:Scientists from New York (state)
title: Josephine Webb
